chapters.title: Initial Accusation and Reflection
chapters.summary: The speaker begins by directly accusing someone of taking advantage of him and reflecting on past financial support given while he was vulnerable.

chapters.title: Confusion and Disconnection
chapters.summary: The speaker expresses confusion and hurt related to a perceived lack of connection and knowledge from the other person, referencing a strained relationship.

chapters.title: Repeating the Core Complaint
chapters.summary: The speaker reiterates the core accusation – the other person is taking advantage of his generosity and affection.

chapters.title: Expressing Fear and Loss of Control
chapters.summary: The speaker reveals a fear of the other person’s actions and indicates a loss of control over his own decisions and well-being.
